subject: Personal Finance
title: The Big Mac Index
description: A fast breakdown of The Big Mac Index for builders.

hook.text: A Big Mac costs $5.69 in the US and $2.45 in India. This tells economists something profound.

buildup.text: The Economist invented the Big Mac Index to compare purchasing power across countries.

discovery.text: If a Big Mac costs less in one country, its currency may be undervalued relative to the dollar.

twist.text: It's a lighthearted tool, but it reveals real gaps between exchange rates and actual purchasing power.

climax.text: Purchasing power parity helps explain why a $30K salary in Vietnam can feel like $80K in the US.

punchline.text: A burger can measure a currency.

quiz.question: What does the Big Mac Index measure?
options: The quality of fast food globally
